item.title: Nicola add a quote by Truman Capote
item.description: "Failure is the condiment that gives success its flavor." -- Truman Capote

item.title: Nicola add a quote by Brian Andreas
item.description: "I read once that the ancient Egyptians had fifty words for sand & the Eskimos had a hundred words for snow. I wish I had a thousand words for love, but all that comes to mind is the way you move against me while you sleep & there are no words for that." -- Brian Andreas

item.title: Nicola add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "I warn you, if you bore me, I shall take my revenge." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Nicola add a quote by Pierre Teilhard De Chardin
item.description: "Someday, after mastering the winds, the waves, the tides and gravity, we shall harness for God the energies of love, and then, for a second time in the history of the world, man will have discovered fire." -- Pierre Teilhard De Chardin

item.title: Nicola add a quote by Eric Roth
item.description: "For what it’s worth: it’s never too late or, in my case, too early to be whoever you want to be. There’s no time limit, stop whenever you want. You can change or stay the same, there are no rules to this thing. We can make the best or the worst of it. I hope you make the best of it. And I hope you see things that startle you. I hope you feel things you never felt before. I hope you meet people with a different point of view. I hope you live a life you’re proud of. If you find that you’re not, I hope you have the courage to start all over again." -- Eric Roth

item.title: Nicola add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Be yourself; everyone else is already taken." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Nicola add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description: "You'll find another.' God! Banish the thought. Why don't you tell me that 'if the girl had been worth having she'd have waited for you'? No, sir, the girl really worth having won't wait for anybody." -- F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.title: Nicola add a quote by Toni Morrison
item.description: "Don't ever think I fell for you, or fell over you. I didn't fall in love, I rose in it." -- Toni Morrison

item.title: Nicola add a quote by Louise Erdrich
item.description: "Life will break you. Nobody can protect you from that, and living alone won't either, for solitude will also break you with its yearning. You have to love. You have to feel. It is the reason you are here on earth. You are here to risk your heart. You are here to be swallowed up. And when it happens that you are broken, or betrayed, or left, or hurt, or death brushes near, let yourself sit by an apple tree and listen to the apples falling all around you in heaps, wasting their sweetness. Tell yourself you tasted as many as you could." -- Louise Erdrich

item.title: Nicola add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "If you want to really hurt you parents, and you don't have the nerve to be gay, the least you can do is go into the arts. I'm not kidding. The arts are not a way to make a living. They are a very human way of making life more bearable. Practicing an art, no matter how well or badly, is a way to make your soul grow, for heaven's sake. Sing in the shower. Dance to the radio. Tell stories. Write a poem to a friend, even a lousy poem. Do it as well as you possible can. You will get an enormous reward. You will have created something." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Nicola add a quote by Gabriel García Márquez
item.description: "He allowed himself to be swayed by his conviction that human beings are not born once and for all on the day their mothers give birth to them, but that life obliges them over and over again to give birth to themselves." -- Gabriel García Márquez

item.title: Nicola add a quote by Gabriel García Márquez
item.description: "It is not true that people stop pursuing dreams because they grow old, they grow old because they stop pursuing dreams." -- Gabriel García Márquez

item.title: Nicola add a quote by Gabriel García Márquez
item.description: "There is always something left to love." -- Gabriel García Márquez

item.title: Nicola add a quote by Gabriel García Márquez
item.description: "He was still too young to know that the heart's memory eliminates the bad and magnifies the good, and that thanks to this artifice we manage to endure the burden of the past." -- Gabriel García Márquez

item.title: Nicola add a quote by Gabriel Garcia Marquez
item.description: "my heart has more rooms in it than a whore house" -- Gabriel Garcia Marquez

item.title: Nicola add a quote by Gabriel Garcia Marquez
item.description: "It was inevitable: the scent of bitter almonds always reminded him of the fate of unrequited love." -- Gabriel Garcia Marquez

item.title: Nicola add a quote by Gabriel García Márquez
item.description: "Tell him yes. Even if you are dying of fear, even if you are sorry later, because whatever you do, you will be sorry all the rest of your life if you say no." -- Gabriel García Márquez

item.title: Nicola add a quote by Gabriel García Márquez
item.description: "The world must be all fucked up," he said then, "when men travel first class and literature goes as freight." -- Gabriel García Márquez

item.title: Nicola add a quote by Gabriel García Márquez
item.description: "wisdom comes to us when it can no longer do any good." -- Gabriel García Márquez

item.title: Nicola add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "In a good bookroom you feel in some mysterious way that you are absorbing the wisdom contained in all the books through your skin, without even opening them." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Nicola add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "Be not afraid of greatness. Some are born great, some achieve greatness, and others have greatness thrust upon them." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Nicola add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description:
"All that is gold does not glitter, Not all those who wander are lost; The old that is strong does not wither, Deep roots are not reached by the frost.
From the ashes a fire shall be woken, A light from the shadows shall spring; Renewed shall be blade that was broken, The crownless again shall be king." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Nicola add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Good friends, good books, and a sleepy conscience: this is the ideal life." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Nicola add a quote by Charles Dickens
item.description: "The unqualified truth is, that when I loved Estella with the love of a man, I loved her simply because I found her irresistible. Once for all; I knew to my sorrow, often and often, if not always, that I loved her against reason, against promise, against peace, against hope, against happiness, against all discouragement that could be. Once for all; I love her none the less because I knew it, and it had no more influence in restraining me, than if I had devoutly believed her to be human perfection." -- Charles Dickens

item.title: Nicola add a quote by Leo Tolstoy
item.description: "Everyone thinks of changing the world, but no one thinks of changing himself." -- Leo Tolstoy

item.title: Nicola add a quote by Audrey Hepburn
item.description: "I believe in pink. I believe that laughing is the best calorie burner. I believe in kissing, kissing a lot. I believe in being strong when everything seems to be going wrong. I believe that happy girls are the prettiest girls. I believe that tomorrow is another day and I believe in miracles." -- Audrey Hepburn

item.title: Nicola add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I am so clever that sometimes I don't understand a single word of what I am saying." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Nicola add a quote by Milan Kundera
item.description: "We can never know what to want, because, living only one life, we can neither compare it with our previous lives nor perfect it in our lives to come." -- Milan Kundera

item.title: Nicola add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "So many books, so little time." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: Nicola add a quote by Ann Patchett
item.description: "It makes you wonder. All the brilliant things we might have done with our lives if only we suspected we knew how." -- Ann Patchett
